data_usage: Multi-model mean CMIP3 (lower emissions scenario) temperature projections were plotted for Alaska, for 2021-2050 relative to 1971-1999.
methodology:
1. For each model at each grid point, the mean annual temperature under the lower emissions scenario (B1) was calculated.
2. For each model, these data were re-gridded to a common grid.
3. For each model at each grid point, the mean temperature under the lower emissions scenario (B1) was calculated for two periods: 1971-1999 and 2021-2050.
4. At each grid point, the mean temperature for the two periods was computed by averaging the following models:
CCSM3, CGCM3.1 (T47), CNRM-CM3, CSIRO-Mk3.0, ECHAM5/MPI-OM, ECHO-G, GFDL-CM2.0, GFDL-CM2.1, INM-CM3.0, IPSL-CM4, MIROC3.2 (medres), MRI-CGCM2.3.2, PCM, UKMO-HadCM3, and UKMO-HadGEM1
5. At each grid point, the difference in projected temperature was calculated for 2021-2050 minus 1971-1999.
6. Data were plotted for grid points in Alaska.
notes: Fortran 95 was used to perform numerical calculations. ArcGIS was used to visualize the data.
